Reviews.Title: “A Scam???”
Reviews.Author: mstarzOhio
Reviews.Content: On March 23 we booked this hotel for 5 nights (April 25-30) using a credit card through Booking.com. On April 24th, we received a notice from Booking.com that our hotel reservation had been canceled because our credit card had been rejected and we had not responded to the email Booking.com had supposedly sent us but which we never got. (We always get all the other email advertisement from Booking.com....) We called the hotel immediately. They told us they had already sold our room to someone else. They also said they had not canceled the room; it was done, they said, by Booking.com. Booking.com said the hotel had canceled our room; not they. April 25th is a major day of celebration in Venice; everything, of course, is already booked. I'm sure the hotel was able to resell our room for much more money on April 24th. The hotel made no effort to help us. I'm sure they must have known some other hotel owners and could have helped us had they chosen to do so. They chose to do nothing.

Reviews.Title: “A Con do not book here”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsHolidayqueen
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel . Do not know why expedia is still listing it. Read the reviews on trip adviser. If you book here there is a very good chance you will not stay here. I booked for 3 nights before problems as outlined on Trip advisor, then read reviews and began to worry. Sure enough turned up having carried cases over Rialto bridge - no mean feat but we were prepared- only to be given the usual bluff "owing to problems beyond our control ...... plumbing.... moved to another of our buildings 15 minutes away" . So we waited to be taken to "other building" turned out to be the Hotel San Moise on the other side of the Grand canal in San Marco. We were told to make up for the inconvenience we would be placed in a superior room, if that was the case I do not know what a good room looks like . At top of hotel up 2 flights of stairs and then when room door opened more stairs, stained carpet, light hanging by a thin wire above head tatty unpainted shutters and mosquitoes. There is quirky and there is grubby and down at heel. This was the latter. On a positive note very near St Marks Square and good for ferry to airport home . If you want to know where you are going to stay do not book this hotel. I often write reviews and have never before felt the need to advise against using a hotel but this experience set a very bad note for our time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “One of my worst hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: Brett J
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is superb as it is right by the Rialto bridge; however, the smell inside the hotel was awful. Everyone warned me about the canal smelling (which it actually didn't when we were there), but the hotel was so bad that we had to find a side exit to leave from each morning. There were also mosquitoes in our room. We were rudely scurried off from breakfast in the morning. I definitely won't be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Grand Canal, Riv Du Vin, only restaurants right on canal in front of Rialto”
Reviews.Author: gigicleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: It's old, it's beautiful, it's on the Riv du Vin, one of the only spots in Venice where you can step out your front door onto land (actually about 5 restaurants.) view of Rialto bridge. gondola right at front sidewalk. includes lovely breakfast. It's not the Danielle, but it's not $1,000 a night either. friendly, arranged FREE water taxi for my family to Murano.

Reviews.Title: “Did the same to us”
Reviews.Author: edandlinda7
Reviews.Content: I made a reservations months in advance and when we got there in the rain, we were told we were moved to a different hotel! the other hotel was nice but not on the water as we had wanted. There was no compensation for the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jake B
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel Marconi in the pouring rain! They sorted us out and helped us get warm very fast. The hotel is based in a very central location, walking distance and close to public transport and restraunts. If i went back to venice, i wouldn't go anywhere else. Hotel Marconi is such a great place!! If your thinking of going there, do it!! Great breakfast, great beds and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location from which to experience Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pucela08
Reviews.Content: Located near the Rialto Bridge, the Hotel sits near the Grand Canal and evokes an old-world quaintness. It is not a high-tech, modernist hotel. The rooms provide the needed comfortable and are well-maintained. The staff, welcoming and helpful, provided assistance and recommendations. Although we had no problems with our room, some other folks did experience difficulties. We were impressed by the breakfast buffet with plenty to eat, including fruits. The location was prime for us, and we were not disappointed. Across from the hotel, there was a vaporetto stop, and it was an easy walk to other areas of the city. The nearness to the Rialto was a definite plus too. And the area behind the hotel contained numerous was eateries and cafÃ©s. You must wander and explore. I would definitely return to the Marconi enjoy this impressive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: munshado
Reviews.Content: As everyone knows, Venice is not cheap. We had reservations at a different hotel...not naming names, it was a dive. So we skipped out and went in search of another place. I had originally booked at the Marconi and cancelled because I thought it looked to touristy being right on the main canal. Well, that is right where we ended up, in our quest for a decent place. What a savior. They had a room and were very helpful. It was right next to the Rialto bridge, which made it easy to find and convenient to use the water buses. When we got to our room it was great. Our own small but well equipped bathroom. It had radiators that warmed our towels. Not a view of the canal but the fresh air and view into the alley was quaint. We slept well as our room was nice and quiet. For the price it was a great deal and breakfast was a fine buffet with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Caution: If you book here you'll very likely moved to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: lufa
Reviews.Content: In August we (my wife and I) bought one night in Venice through Groupalia with the "roulette" formula, which in our case meant: you pay and you'll be able to stay at Marconi, CÃ  Alvise, Athenaeum or San MoisÃ¨. We reserved in mid August for one night in November and were assigned the Hotel Marconi. I received an official email from Hotel Marconi with a confirmation code: just to say that this was an official reservation. More, in the confirmation email was written "attention: prepaid reservation, not refundable. No cancellation or modification will be possible". Later I gave a look to the reviews here on Tripadvisor and read about that a lot of angry people that were moved to other hotels with various excuses, so I told my wife: "bet we'll be moved somewhere else...". I got it! In fact, we arrived to Hotel Marconi after having walked a lot with our bag (fortunately it was a wonderful sunny day) and the girl at the reception, after having copied our documents and my credit card (as a guarantee for the minibar!!!) told us that there was a problem with the room because the person that was occupying it had an health problem during the night (this is indeed an excellent, disarming excuse) so we were had to go to the Hotel San MoisÃ¨, walking for another 15 minutes from Rialto to San Marco. Given some reviews that I have read about the Marconi, probably we were rather lucky because the room at the San MoisÃ¨ was not bad and breakfast was also good, but folks...DO EXPECT TO BE MOVED EVEN IF YOU RESERVED 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE. Note that they also tend to fool you because the girl said the we had chosen the roulette formula, so we could expect to be moved.Obviously we put in front of her nose the reservation number below the symbol of the Marconi Hotel. Later we found that two brothers owe these 4 and other 3 hotels in venice (see "www.hotelsinvenice.com") . This is the explanation why it's very likely that you come to here and they feel free to move to another of these hotels: they simply apply the roulette rule in all cases....good luck,but Venice does not deserve these people.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: MeophamMelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2011 for 3 nights and not forgetting that this is a 3 Star hotel we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were given a canal side room with private balcony overlooking the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge. Whilst the room was relatively small (as we expected) the bed was very comfortable and the room had a safe (free), mini bar and hair dryer. The bathroom although narrow was modern and clean. Breakfast in a basement room was more than adequate. But by far the best feature of this hotel was its location. St. Marks square was an easy walk through very pleasant surroundings. Canal side restaurants are located just outside The hotel and whilst busy, were not noisy even in our room which looked over them. I would definitely have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel to others and staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “So Venice”
Reviews.Author: Andrewwf1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days in October with our two boys and also got a room at the back but there was enough space and the room felt like it hadn't changed for 200 years, which was so right for this city. The staff were mostly friendly and breakfast was just fine. All in all a great start to our roadtrip.

Reviews.Title: “Marconi scam”
Reviews.Author: kevin r
Reviews.Content: This Hotel have a lot of problems with "broken pipes" it would appear. We too arrived at this very conveniently located hotel near the Rialto Bridge only to be told of the unfortunate circumstances of the pipes and that we had been "upgraded" to a nearby Hotel. Funny that , as some of the comments I had read before going was that this happened to other travelers. Seems a convenient way of filling other related hotels maybe. Anyway , it meant nothing to us as long as the alternative was in the centre of Venice and the comparable quality , which it was,

Reviews.Title: “SCAM! Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tlong60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful! The staff is rude. Rooms are dirty. This hotel pulls a scam where they put you in their "other" building, which is actually a different hotel not even on the GC. They will lie to your face and say there is a problem with your room. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great way to visit Venice”
Reviews.Author: 45PD
Reviews.Content: A small friendly hotel in a brilliant location next to The Rialto Bridge in the heart of Venice.Booked at short notice and was pleasantly surprised.30min.water taxi journey from Marco Polo airport. Friendly helpful English speaking reception.Nice well equipped superior room with air con.10 min walk to St Marks Sq.and opposite a main water taxi stop. lots of great shopping and eating places. I loved this hotel and will return later this year when Venice is cooler.PD

Reviews.Title: “good location poor staff”
Reviews.Author: george j
Reviews.Content: you cannot beat the location near rialto bridge,but the main lady at front desk is busy on the phone always,she wont spend any time accomodating guests.or advising them. breakfast is ok.rooms are very small for a family.venice has the worst rude people in the tourim industry in italy,i dont know why people bother going a second time there after seeing the dirty canals,and riding the gondola for 200 euros.i saw waiters in the hotels next to marconi hotel kick couple families of 5 or six each when the dad told the waiter that one or two kids in the party are not hungry,and only 3 out of five will order,they wont spend time to explain menue specifics or certain plates ,they give arrogant rude looks on every thing,i didnot care for venice or its people in general.and these are places next to this hotel.of course its not the hotel fault or problem,just mentioning facts about this city.taxi ride in the private little boats is 105 to 115 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyreview
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of 9 friends in Hotel Marconi for two nights during the peak tourist season in August. The location is great, right next to the Rialto Bridge. The hotel style and rooms are a bit quirky with everything you need for a weekend break. The breakfast was good too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: drej424
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mom and my 2 daughters for 3 days. We were really happy with this hotel. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Yezman
Reviews.Content: We have some concerns about our reservations after reading trip advisor,but we found the Marconi to be quite suitable for our needs. We booked a family room and they indicated that we were in the family suite which had a view overlooking the Grand Canal and a balcony. The room had a Queen and two twins and a very large and nice bathroom. not sure about the other rooms, but ours was better than expected.. The staff brought our luggage to the room. breakfast was very good. front desk staff was ok...not particularly personable, but helped when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, but certain front desk person should get off the phone”
Reviews.Author: LeoEllen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly basic, but you can't beat the location! For the price, this is the place to be. The only annoyance was a certain young front desk person who was constantly chatting on the phone with friends (I understand enough Italian to tell business from personal), just reluctantly diverting her attention to customers. She was also very rude to other staff people in the hotel. And what irked me the most is that she used a lot of four letter words in these conversations, probably thinking that customers don't understand Italian. Or she just didn't care if customers understood or not. A turn-off, although otherwise it is an OK hotel in fantastic location, right by the Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “An openly RACIST hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunflower201127
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location Cons: 1 - Racist (openly). There was a big difference in the way we were treated versus caucasians. Non-whites are not welcome here. 2 - Dirty 3 - Rude 4 - Useless breakfast 5 - Noisy 6 - Match box sized rooms. (no room for more than 1 luggage bag) 7 - no renovation

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Scamsters and gangsters. You must read our experience before booking.”
Reviews.Author: runningman2
Reviews.Content: I cant believe the good reviews this hotel has received. Undoubtly the location is great, but where is the service and the cleanliness. Here's a tip for all readers to distinguish the genuine reviews from the false ones ... if anyone rates this hotel 5 stars in cleanliness, then that review is false!! It appears that the hotel has had no renovations forever, and smells horribly of mildew. The carpet is old, and you can see aging cans of coke and other sodas all over the lobby. Anyway, thats not the real reason why we had a terrible experience. We were a group of 4 senior couples visiting Italy and Venice specifically for 3 nights. Our reservation clearly stated "handicap accessible rooms preferred". I understand that is not a guarantee, but the hotel didnt have the courtesy of advising us that not only dont they have handicapped accessible rooms, but they even DONT have an elevator. What annoyed us, that NO where on any travel website or the hotel website they mention that. If that wasnt enough, I should have paid heed to several warnings in tripadvisor of their bait and switch scam. They wanted to move 2 of the couples in our party to their sister property (some 10 minutes away) on the excuse of some technical issues on the first floor. It keeps getting worse. When we refused to move to the sister property, their manager had the audacity to tell us to take their offer or find another hotel! Having no choice we decided to call our travel agent to find out the room rates of their sister property. At that time, that property was at least 50 euros less than this one. And here's where our nightmare really began. We thought that it was only fair that the hotel then refund us the difference. The manager denied the refund saying that we got a super saver deal which was very low to begin with. However, when we decided to remain adamant on our demands, he told us "that he has no room in the hotel for disrespectful old people" and CANCELLED our entire reservation. In all honestlly we panicked, and requested him that we dont care for the discount, but need the rooms. The manager showed no courtesy, and told us to go away! We were really shocked having a lot of luggage not knowing where to find a room in Venice at last minute. God bless our travel agent, who made arrangements for us at the last minute, and we were fortunate that we arrived in the late afternoon when US had just opened allowing us to reach our travel agent. My hand still trembles as I write this review. Stay away from this hotel from hell!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, excellent staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: venice50
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights, the service was very good, the hotel was clean and the breakfast was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book”
Reviews.Author: Tsr_11
Reviews.Content: I booked Marconi hotel, Venice, Italy, in December 2010, check-in date was July 7, 2011, for 1 night for 4 persons. When we arrived to the hotel the staff said to us, that there was a problem with our room and they offered us to change the hotel. From the reviews on TripAdvisor I had already known that it was a common practice for the hotel Marconi, but only one thing that I can won after the hour of negotiations with receptionist was that she offer us to change to the better star hotel Ca' Alvise, 15 minutes on foot, not on the Canal Grande. The receptionist was not rude, but she neither wanted to solve our problem nor allowed us to speak with the manager. The hotel Ca' Alvise was not bad, but we were already in a bad mood. DON'T LET HOTEL MARCONI RUIN YOUR VENICE EXPERIENCE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this cockroach ridden place *** NO ELEVATORS ... YUCK!!”
Reviews.Author: cookoobird
Reviews.Content: I dont know where to begin. Lets first start with the good. The location is great. And thats it!! Stop!! nothing else. The staff is rude and loud. If you are a light sleeper, then be prepared for no sleep, cause the location is also a drawback ... its noisy. Really noisy. This is an old building that has zero renovation. THERE IS NO ELEVATOR in this dump, and the rooms on the first 2 floors (due to its proximity to the canal and lack of renovation) smell of mildue. The rooms are as big as a match box, and I booked a family room that can sleep 6 and paid 400$/night. The free breakfast is a joke!! My first room was on the 2nd floor and the bathroom was infested with cockroaches. I requested a change and was met with a frown and moved to the 4th floor with a lot of resistance. I explained that i have 2 young children, and would love a room on the 1st floor (despite the mildew). They wanted to move me to a sister property 15 minutes away. There are so many things bad with this hotel that i can go on and on. Spend a little more, and get a better place. I wish i did that.

Reviews.Title: “old and nice”
Reviews.Author: justustravellers
Reviews.Content: the hotel is next to the rialto bridge, so a very busy area. when you arrive with a couple of suitcase, if you arrive by the water bus, you will have to be patient to get to your hotel. as you will have to cross over the rialto bridge. the hotel is charming, but old. we paid for a superior room, which we were told make its bigger than the other rooms. well good luck to those other people. the room was quite small, but expected. we had a view of a back alley and if you leaned over the balcony, you could see a little bit of the grand cana. the bathroom was of a good size and fairly modern. the room was clean and the staff helpful. but they do have a tendency to answer the phone and ignore you when you are standing in front of them. we would recommend this hotel, even though it was expensive, because of its location. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Marconi...yeah right!”
Reviews.Author: Jumper007
Reviews.Content: â€œHotel Marconiâ€� ruined my Venice experience. I am writing this review hoping to prevent others from having their Venice experience ruined also. I have travelled to many places throughout Europe and across the World, yet I have never had an experience with a Hotel as awful as I had with Hotel Marconi in Venice....it simply ruined my vacation! We arrived to Hotel Marconi a happy bunch full of excitement as you can imagine when coming to Venice....after all its Venice and we had heard so much about it with its canals and its uniqueness! As we went to check in we got told that we would be shown to our room in another building. This seemed a little strange, so we enquired further. Upon our enquiring, the receptionist said that â€œthere was a problem but it has been solvedâ€�. After trying to enquire further as to the problem to no avail, we set across Venice with luggage in hand to Hotel Aeterna, which apparently is â€œthe same Hotelâ€�. The receptionist at Hotel Marconi insisted it was only â€œ5 minutesâ€� away....maybe she usually takes a little scooter or something cause this place was closer to 15 minutes away by foot. When we arrived at Hotel Aetena, things didnt get much better. The staff at reception were rude, incompetent and plain ignorant. The matchbox sized room was a joke. It was like the room had been built so that the bed could neatly fit within the confined space of the walls, but they forgot about the need for floor space to store luggage, get changed (maybe this was to be done on the bed?)....or even walk! The bathroom was another matter again, the smallest (not to mention the dirtiest) bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel, and the door didnâ€™t even stay shut! Clearly Hotel Marconi is used to lure travellers in to this Hotel chain scam, with its location, before shipping them off to sister Hotels that no one in their right mind would ever want to book for. DONT LET HOTEL MARCONI RUIN YOUR VENICE EXPERIENCE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch Scam! Do Not Book!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingjjp
Reviews.Content: This is nothing more than a bait and switch scam! Do not be fooled! You will not be staying at the Hotel Marconi but rather a 2nd rate hotel 15 minutes away and nowhere near the main canal. I know there are some positive reviews on this site, but on closer examination I think there are a lot of fake ones (e.g. the most recent positive review is from a woman who reviewed four Florence hotels on the same day! Surely she didn't stay in four different hotels in the same city at the same time). When we arrived at the hotel we were told that we had to go to their other hotel '5 minutes' away with no explanation. When we asked why, since we booked for this hotel, they brushed us off saying that it was the same hotel and eventually made up a story about a problem with our room. If you read other peoples reviews, you will see this is clearly a common occurrence. Turns out the other hotel was actually 15 minutes away. To get there, we had to walk through numerous streets in the sweltering heat carrying all of our suitcases OURSELVES! If you've been to Venice, you know how many stairs you need to go up and down just to get anywhere. When we got to the other hotel we asked for a refund as this was not the hotel we booked for. I've never met someone who was so rude. The lady told us point blank that there was no way they would give us a refund as this was the same hotel. I don't know if they thought we were stupid or what - clearly it was not the same hotel - it was 15 minutes away and had a different name!!! The rooms themselves were terrible. The bathroom was like a public bathroom with chipped tiles, a broken lock, etc. What was also strange was that when we would leave the hotel, they would ask us for our key back. I have never been to a hotel in my life where I've had to do this. We did not feel safe even leaving our things in the room so felt no choice but to take all of our valuables with us wherever we'd go.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't book here”
Reviews.Author: NewTraveller1969
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on the hotel's website on 31 August 2010. They confirmed the booking again on 2 May 2011 by e-mail. We went on a cruise and arrived at the hotel on Saturday, 21 May 2011 only to hear that there is a problem with our room. They offered us a room at a sister hotel across from Venice. It was so far the receptionist couldn't even find it on the Venice map the hotel offers. We demanded to see the manager but to no avail. We had to search for a nearby room on foot by ourselves on a Saturday night in high tourist season!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Angela60974
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after reading some of these reviews, but everything ran smoothly! So easy to find after get off the water bus at the Rialto bridge--I envisioned wandering the bizarre streets and bridges of Venice at night lugging my stuff, but we found it right away. No elevator, but who cares! Enough of being a lazy American :) They had old school keys with the big tassel you had to hand to the desk before leaving the hotel--I felt like I was in an Italian movie! The staff was helpful, best hairdryer in Italy, breakfast was great, it was quiet (I had the best sleep here of anywhere else we stayed in Italy) would definitely stay here again, if only for the incredibly convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Scam - Avoid !”
Reviews.Author: etcetera1984
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to a nice relaxing time in Venice and had booked a room at Hotel Marconi based on reviews on tripadvisor. When I got to the hotel, they told me that there was a problem with my room and that they solved it by putting me in their "sister" hotel that was a 5 minute walk away. When asked what the problem was, they were rude and refused to answer why. Judging from the amount of luggage under the stairs, it was clear that they overbooked. I had to walk a 10-15 minute walk away to Hotel Athena where I spent the worst night of my life for a hotel that you pay over 100 quid to stay in. So much so, I had to make sure I was good and drunk to even be able to stay in it. Everything you touched was dirty and I had broken out in hives while staying there. Couldn't wait to get out of there quicker! AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leesh_UK
Reviews.Content: There are not enough words to describe how bad this place really is!! DO NOT COME TO THIS HOTEL IF YOU WANT TO ENJOY YOUR STAY IN VENICE!!!!! As soon as we checked in to this hotel, we got told there was a 'problem with the hotell' and got made to walk 10-15 minutes across the busy town with our luggage from this hotel (right by the water, which is why we had booked this hotel) to a chain hotel in the middle of town called Hotel Aetena. When we questioned the reception staff about why we had to change hotels, they were rude and ignorant and kept insisting that this was the 'same hotel' so did not see any problem in making us stay in a hotel different to the hotel we booked!! We all realised pretty early on that this hotel and its chain hotels were clearly a scam aimed at tourists. When we asked for a refund of our money, they refused and were not helpful or pleasant to deal with whatsoever. I have never met people as rude as them in my life!!! (and I live in London so that's saying something!) To add to our grief, our double bedroom in Hotel Aetena was so small.. all that fit in the room was a bed.. not even enought space on the floor to put our luggage! The bathroom door couldnt even open up completely because the bed was in front of the door blocking it. Also, when going in to the bathroom, theres barely enough space in there to move! The cleanliness of the bathroom is another horror story as well. We also got asked to hand our room keys back to reception every time we left the room for 'security measures' so that the staff could see who was in their rooms at what times. I've never had to do this at any hotel i've ever stayed in... and was worried about my luggage in the room being touched the whole time i was away from the hotel!! I cannot emphasise enough how bad this place really is. Please - do not stay here if you want to enjoy yourself in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: whyme30
Reviews.Content: There is no elevator... Wes were placed on the third floor with shabby area carpets and a view of ladies hanging clothes on their "out-window" clothes lines on all three floors in a dark alley..this was our view. the First day there, we were told the shower was leaking water into the room below and they had to move us. The room we moved to was 10 X 15 ft. With the headboard at one wall, there was 2 feet to the wall at the end of the bed. They would not give us a TV that worked...The enterances to this room (2) were through the kitchen. The other was from the Alley (literally). The room they put us in and another, I suppose the dame size had the same entrance. If you wanted to go via the Lobby, you had to go up one flight, go dawn one flight, through the kitched and out the back to these two rooms. There was hardly room for us and the luggage. I would let my dog stay there.. Hotels.com kept hanging up. I never could speak to anyone at hotels.com I could understand. They could not/would not give me a tel # in the US to call from Georgia.. It was either India or S. America. NO to HOotels.com!!!!!!! Their " ON-LINE - Hotels.com photos are from some other place (as for the looks of the rooms).. It ruined my stay in Venice.. I had rather slept on the dock, at least I would have had some "foot room" for my feet to hang off a "full-sized" bed and not hick the opposite wall.. Don't believe me??? Book a room there!!! Then you can write one of these fine reviews... The other 6 cities and gotels were as described.. OH yeah, NO ELEVATOR!!!! It HAS NOT been updated since the 20's as advertised by Hotels.com... I can reach no one to talk to about this... NO ONE!!!! OH yes, I asked the girl about the leak in the other room, she said "No Comment". They had moved someone else into our original room and used the "LEAK" as an excuse to move us out... Must have been some Italians they wanted to please... and moved them into our original room...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zinnia25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2001 so booked an overnight stay with our friends after our cruise. The hotel is so well located on the main canal with water taxis, water buses nearby. Complimentary water taxi takes you to Murano to the glass works where you do need deep pockets but it is an interesting trip. Breakfast at hotel is excellent and reception staff are helpful and arranged for the water taxi to take us to airport the next morning. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But So So Service”
Reviews.Author: Peens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nice post cruise. The rooms are nice, bathrooms spacious with good showers and water pressure, beds are comfy too. It's in a really good location, right off the Rialto Bridge, but they have no lift. The front desk, however, is a bit of a hit or miss, depending on who serves you. We had the displeasure of being serviced by Federico who was not friendly, not welcoming, and gave us wrong information on vaporetto services, questions about our room, etc . For this, we would not stay here again, that's for sure. Stay at Palazzo Bembo instead, same price, and much better service! This is the fist time I give a hotel on TA a thumbs down!!! Sorry Marconi, but you should get rid of guy...!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: lm55417
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. It's a great, old hotel that is well maintained and updated. The biggest downside would be the thin walls - heard everything next door - and no elevator, but the staff is very good about getting your bags to and from your room for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old world flavor, no elevator. Helpful staff with getting around.”
Reviews.Author: jg12318
Reviews.Content: Fabulous view of Rialto Bridge and canal. Near great restaurants and shopping. There is no elevator so ask for a low floor unless you enjoy steps.

Reviews.Title: “Rude racist people”
Reviews.Author: srbgyl
Reviews.Content: Non Italians not welcome here. The staff are terrible

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Stunning City”
Reviews.Author: PNWsailor
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks just sad from the outside but looks in this ancient city are deceaving. The htoel is well updates with vey comfortable rooms. The staff were very good and accomodating/ We loved Venice much more than I thought we would. Facinating place. Walk and walk to enjoy it all. We also benefited from a pass on the canal water buses. Hotel is well located right beside the Realto Bridge. The guidebooks are right, do get sucked in to eating at the canal side resturants. None are worth the money and there are many many better resturants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't really everything...but it's close.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMears
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 3 nights at the Marconi. As a base camp for Venice exploration, you can't get much closer to the center of attention. All the craziness that is the Rialto area is literally at your doorstep. I actually booked a "Superior Double" direct with the hotel in hopes that we would get a room with a Grand Canal view. After all, if we were going to the middle of the beehive, why not witness it from the comfort of our own room. But be advised - the hotel only has two rooms with canal views, and one is a room for four people, so if you have your hopes sent on a canal view....think again. We were put in a dark alley view room with a small window, but asked for a room with more light and we were moved to room 202 with a small step out with more light. The rooms are varied in size from what we can tell but clean with functional bathrooms. The staff is present and helpful and the breakfast was hearty (don't show up too late - they tend to run out of the best stuff). Our bottom line: If you don't expect a view window and want to stay RIGHT THERE - this is a hotel you should look at. We'll have fond memories of the Marconi for years to come, but when we go back, we'll be looking for something outside the San Marco-Rialto roller derby with more space and a bit more light. Some more bits: We took a water taxi from the Marconi directly to the port to catch a cruise. It was the best 80 Euros we ever spent. Great ride and the cruise folks take your bags right from the water taxi. Do it if you are taking a cruise. And get up early if you stay in Venice! The best time is before 10:00AM. There won't be much open, but if you are a runner...or just a walker...Venice is a whole different (and better) animal early. Likewise for the end of the day. Stay up late! You can sleep when you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Marconi - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_in_20s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2010. The Hotel Marconi is a lovely hotel. We picked it mainly due to reviews we read online but also for the location and you won't find many more hotels in a more picturesque location. It is literally steps away from the Rialto Bridge. we did spend a little bit more on this hotel than we normally would but were able to keep relatively within our budget and were quite happy with what we got. The staff are nice enough, the room we were given was lovely, there is no internet access and we had a problem when we used our own hairdryer in the room, it tripped the fuse so all of the electricity to our room went but they were able to fix that quite quickly. All of the major sites, like St. Marks Square, are within walking distance and there is two vaporetto stops outside along the canal nearby. There is also a stop for the water bus to the airport on the other side of the canal. The rialto market is also right outside the hotel. Overall we were quite happy. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, tourist trap area”
Reviews.Author: DSAustin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, rooms are spacious. This was the least favorite hotel of our two week trek across Italy. The walls are thin! The area is a great location however it's a tourist trap. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! 5 stars all the way”
Reviews.Author: Maribel12
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Marconi was probably the best decision I made while planning my trip to Venice. The hotel's location is unbeatable, the setting is beautiful, the facilities are wonderful! My room was equipped with a superb bathroom which I found to be spacious and one of the most comfortable bathrooms I have seen in hotels throughout Italy. The staff are incredible!! the service is 5 stars. They were extremely friendly and professional. I will never forget how comfortable I felt there. I will definitely stay there every time I have the chance to be in beautiful Venice and will recommend the hotel to my colleagues and friends!

Reviews.Title: “This location is perfect, center of the Island, right on the Grand Canal next to the Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: skygoddess333
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, the staff was friendly & helpful, located right by the Rialto Bridge & restaurants. The vaporetto stop is across the bridge, gondolas & water taxis right in front of the hotel. Beautiful atmosphere here and lots of people watching too! The room was small & doubt there is AC.. but who's in the room? Also, no elevator. The breakfast is downstairs in a cute room & includes ham & eggs.. it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not So Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chazdog79
Reviews.Content: The perfect location if you want to be right in the heart of the tourist district which is fine. The problem is that the rooms are a bit tight. Mine overlooked the alley and if you love the smell of burning grease all night then this is the place! No elevator, but I guess I should have know. The porter and housekeepers were nice but the jerks at the front desk were, well, jerks. I guess they figured they don't need to be nice since it is a good location. Breakfast was good. But again, greasy smells and loud. If you like that, then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A so-so hotel near the Rialto Bridge in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sarasotapat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was built in 1932 and has not been updated much since then. Some might call it quaint. Perhaps if there had been some sunlight the hotel might have looked quaint. There is no lift/elevator. It rained most days we were there. Our room was a nice size, but had only one window that looked out onto an alley making the room very dark. It was quiet for sleeping at night. The room was drab in color, but it was comfortable enough. The bathroom had been updated but was small. There was a decent breakfast included in the room rate. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The best thing about this hotel is that it is on the Grand Canal and just a few steps from the Rialto bridge. (Very centrally located). We used a water taxi service to bring us from the airport to the hotel. Due to costs, we selected a â€˜shared ride.â€™ That was probably not a good choice. The taxi dropped us off on the other side of the Rialto Bridge and we had to tote our luggage up and over to get to our hotel. The steps are bad enough; the tourists were even worse as they would not get out of the way. Our advice is to take the water taxi one stop past the Rialto stop when you are arriving. (I believe the stop is San Silvestro.) Then you are on the correct side of the Grand Canal and you donâ€™t have to walk over the bridge with your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: dubguy
Reviews.Content: we have just spent our honeymoon at this hotel and could not have madd a better choice, everything was excellent and thanks to Federico, Matteo and all the staff who made it more like a home than a hotel, nothing was too much trouble for them and they were excellent with any help we required, as i said... we would not consider staying anywhere else when we return to venice next year george & iliana royal (dublin)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View, Good for 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: TravelguySF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location next to the Rialto Bridge. We stayed in a "Luxury" room which was located on the first floor (no elevator). At first we thought it couldn't be the luxury room because it was on the top floor. But, the reason it is the luxury room is because it is quite spacious and has it's own balcony with an amazing view of the Rialto Bridge and Grand Canal. We thought it would be loud because all the restaurants have their outside dining right below the room, but the noise didn't seem to bother us at all. I guess the old windows did a good job of blocking out the sound. The room is what you would expect from a 3 star hotel in Europe. It was a bit tired and worn with outdated furniture. But, it was clean and big. The bathroom was a decent size too and had a good shower/tub. We did get a chance to peer into other rooms as they were being cleaned. Several of the rooms were quite small. One room had a twin bed in it and had only a couple feet to spare between the side of the bed and the opposite wall. The breakfast was plentiful (scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, yogurt, fruits, rolls, croissants, etc.). The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: LondonKarenH
Reviews.Content: Ok well its hard to review this hotel specifically as the inevitable happened to me...yes I was indeed moved to the sister hotel as previous posts had reported. I was not happy as they only had a single room left and despite arguing why he gave my lovely double room away, got no proper answer. However!!!, the sister hotel had much better rooms. Only 20 yards from Marconi and looked crummy from the outside as they all do. We were upgraded to a canal facing room (room 101 and 102 are the best rooms). Spacious room overlooking the canal. Couldnt fault it. Nice little balcony next to our room too. Despite the romantic canal view boy is Venice noisy! Those boats reversing etc sure made it hard to sleep so take ear plugs if you want a canal room. Breakfast poor /average. However stayed at 3 hotels in Italy that week and this was no worse or better. Free though so one should never complain. Nice reception staff, great location overlooking the buzzing rialto bridge. Getting from airport was a hassle but looking back very easy. Walk to water bus public transport, buy ticket ($13 regular or $25 express - only 15 min quicker so not worth it), find out which one passes the rialto (ours was platform 4 at 5pm) then its really really obvious when you arrive at the Rialto. The hotel stands right out opposite the vaparetto stop. Crossing bridge with luggage wasnt that bad, just bang tourists out of the way and voila you are there. Venice is very easy to walk around and fun to get lost in. The only thing we found lacking was regular shops i.e selling coke, biscuits, cigarettes. Its all about the money Venice so everything is pricey pricey to rip off the tourists so stock up on basics when you find a shop and then enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alpamht
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice but rooms were too small. We upgraded our room of View of Canal at Rialto Bridge side. It was too pricey. We paid 400 Euros for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Marconi”
Reviews.Author: lammy1952
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Marconi with my wife for 4 days in May. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Venice on the Grand Canal and within 50 yards of the Rialto Bridge. It is a perfect central location from whixh to explore all of magical Venice. It is possible that some rooms may be noisy because of the location, however we had room 2 in a small annexe down the side and close to the breakfast room, and this proved to very peaceful and no disturbances from people passing by. The breakfast fare was excellent, ranging from bacon&eggs, through the usual cereals, toast, bread etc and formed a more than adequate start to the day. The Reception staff were all extremely helpful from check-in to providing restaurant recommendations to suit all pockets and situations. In summary an excellent 3 star hotel in the very heart of Venice offering splendid value for money, and I would most definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our first night. Think twice. There are other hotels!”
Reviews.Author: KMTravelers
Reviews.Content: If you really want to stay here, don't pre-pay. Only book this location if you are booking a room with a view. There are plenty of other hotels in Venice with no-view rooms that have even better locations and much kinder service. If you pre-pay or book through another website (hotels.com, Expedia, etc), it is very likely that Hotel Marconi will move you to another hotel for at least the first night. This happened to us and from reading other reviews I see that it appears to be their standard practice, no matter what random excuse they give you. It did ruin our first night and next morning in Venice. This was a place I waited so long to see and it was extremely dissapointing to spend our time shuffling around luggage, unpacking and re-packing and waiting in lobbies when we only had 2 full days/3 nights to stay in Venice. We were exhausted when we arrived and they made us trek 10 minutes on foot accross Venice toting our own luggage up and down stairs in a confusing maze down small allys with barking dogs and dog poop. There was one employee (who would not wait for us) that carried a small amount of our luggage. No appology was made. Nothing was offered to make up for the inconvenience (water taxi transfer, welcome drink, etc). We were treated as if we had inconvenienced THEM, even though they were happy to take our money when we booked our room in advance. We booked our hotel for the location, and we felt very ripped off when they made us move 10 minutes away. I'm not even sure if what they did was legal, since we had already paid. At the other hotel, they had us climb 3 flights of very steep stairs to get to our room. The view was terrible, but the room there was nice. The next morning we had to re-pack and wait for our other room to be ready rather than going out to St Marks Square before the crowds, as we had planned. This was very frustrating. They said we could just leave our luggage in the lobby until the room at the other hotel was ready. We had a computer with us and did not want to just leave it in the lobby or carry it around all day. Plus we had other valuables that we needed to lock in a safe and not carry around in crowded places. Our room at the Marconi was very small, nothing special, the pillows were hard and the noise outside in the ally was loud, but we booked the hotel for the Rialto location. The hotel unfortunately smelled of sewer. The breakfast was probably their best feature. Their customer service was their worst feature. I would never stay at their other hotels either. Their other hotel lied to us and told us they had talked to the Marconi and that they would upgrade our room at the Marconi (after we made a huge complaint), but the Marconi still put us in the same room that they had told us we would have when we arrived. The breakfast was good, but when I walked into the Marconi breakfast room after our second night, it was empty and it looked like they were closing down. The employee said it was closed and when I asked what time it closed at, he said 10:30, but it was only 10:00. We never felt welcome at this hotel during our stay. I felt like the employees hated their jobs and hated the guests. If we had not pre-paid we would have left. We took a look at other hotels closer to St Marks Square and there were PLENTY of open rooms with far better rates and some even had balconies, elevators and views! It may depend on the time of year, but I saw other people walking into hotels and getting rooms on the spot. Once we finished upacking AGAIN and got out to see Venice it was wonderful. So, please don't let this hotel ruin any of your time in Venice! If you have already pre-paid for this hotel, I suggest sending in one member of your party to check and see if there are any available rooms for the night. Find out if the room level that you paid for is available and maybe one with a view. Thank them and leave. After you know what is available, send in your other member several minutes later with the pre-paid reservation, so they can correct the manager if the hotel tells you they have to move you for the night.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lizzard66
Reviews.Content: What a treasure! My friend and I were first-time travelers to Venice, and after hauling too much luggage all over Italy were greeted with friendly service and fanastic recommendations for dinner. The room was gorgeous and charming with Murano sconces and surprisingly spacious bathroom. Breakfast buffet was a treat....something for everyone! I will return in a heartbeat upon my next (hopeful!) trip to Venice, and even recommended the Hotel Marconi to my brother for his honeymoon!!! -Liz from Houston

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Convenient location, helpful staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: usa_traveler_also
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The rooms were nice (small by American standards, but not cramped). Nice buffet breakfast. Staff was helpful and spoke English. Very nice location, generally within walking distance of most sites, although we often used the vaparetto which had two stops convenient to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: PO2
Reviews.Content: We booked via expedia and had paid plus confirmation before we left. Arrived to be told they had no room available and that we would be sent to another location. Tried to convince them to keep us there to no avail. We were sent to Ca' Alvise which was not on the grand canal and very difficult to find

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when booking through other websites”
Reviews.Author: mabbitt
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights in the Marconi through Hotels.com. When we arrived we were told that there was going to be a 'fire inspection' the following day and that they had to have our room clear for it so they had re-booked us into another hotel (Antica Locanda Sturion). Co-incidently the couple who tried to check in before us (they had booked through expedia) were also re-booked in this other hotel. The room that we were given was not what we were expecting for a Â£100 per night room. It was a room built into the roof of the building. The air-con was not functioning properly so we were given a fan to compensate. The fan helped but the room still got very warm and the smell of fish from the restauarant outside created a pretty unpleasant atmosphere. The toilet was very small - sitting down and your knees were against the opposite wall. If you are going to book this hotel, book it through their own website. If they try and move you to another hotel dont let them!

Reviews.Title: “Home on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: peterxy
Reviews.Content: On more than one occasion I have been the lucky recipient of the gracious atmosphere afforded by the Marconi hotel and the warm and helpful assistance of Marco. This hotel is situated in the best part of Venice right next to the Rialto Bridge looking out on the Grand Canal. The staff, the rooms, the food are all superb. Stay long and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “JUST BRILLANT, THE HOTEL EXCEED OUT EXPECTIONS”
Reviews.Author: ski69
Reviews.Content: This review has been wrtitten after touring Italy and Sicily for 32 days, so i have compared this hotel to other 3 star hotels i had stayed in during my trip Located on the canal a perfect spot , the rooms are small but well appointed and very comfortable.The hotel staff were great and very helpful , they recommended a very nice resturant for us located about 15 to 20 minutes walk from the hotel had a meal there 2 nights in row . The hotel is 3 stars and the decor is true to venice and would recommend that you stay here . The breakfast room was beautiful and so to the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, EXCELLENT SERVICE, EXCELLENT LOCATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jantex
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the place!! Great Location, Service was good with friendly staff . Nice sort of traditional Venecian hotel. I do not think you could get a better location to travel to and from all of the mojour attractions. The water Taxi from the airport even stops across the canal, making it VERY easy to arrange airport transferes for a reasonable price!! i WOULD defo USE THIS HOTEL AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION, NICE HOTEL, LACKS COMFORT”
Reviews.Author: gabeha
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through easyclicktravel.com because the hotel's website said that they were fully booked and got it for a STEAL (less than $70/night). For that price, I don't think you can beat it. The hotel is very nice, fairly well equipped and nicely decorated. The morning breakfast is great. The staff easily transitioned from speaking Italian to English to German to French and were knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel was also very small and quaint and they got to know you. They offered free internet when we got there, but changed their service during our stay and started charging 6 EUR/hr. I cannot emphasize this enough with all of the different options in Venice, you can NOT FIND A BETTER LOCATION. The hotel is right on the Rialto Bridge (one of the major attractions in Venice). It is surrounded with great restaurants and shopping for all ages. Most importantly, the hotel is a fifteen minute walk or less from any major attraction on the island. I originally wanted to book a hotel closer to the train station and would have ended up kicking myself if I did. If you don't book the Hotel Marconi, look for another hotel located near the center of the island. Our room was the biggest drawback. We were so disappointed with the room itself that it almost ruined all of the other wonderful things about the hotel. While the bathroom was well equipped and decent sized, the room itself was tiny, even by European standards. The bed was flush against the right and back walls, with about 1 foot of space between it and the left wall. There was about an additional 4 feet of space between the bed and the far wall. Hardly enough space to open the door. Both the bedroom and bathroom window opened up into a tiny enclosed breezeway which went down the center of the building and opened up to the sky. It was about 6 feet wide and 5 feet across, looking only at other windows of the hotel (mostly windows for the hallways). We quickly got over the tiny size, but the room had an overwhelming odor of sewer gas. With the windows open, the scent would come and go throughout the day. With the windows closed, it would build up and become unbearable. Also, the bed was stiff enough that neither of us got a good night sleep in our seven night stay and my back hurt more and more each day. I caught glimpses of various other rooms and they all appeared larger and better equipped. The majority of the rooms appeared to have either a view of the Grand Canal or a street view. When you check in, be sure to request one of these rooms for your own comfort. The rooms also came equipped with a refrigerator, which seems uncommon for a lot of European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bargain but noisey...”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Camel_666
Reviews.Content: Great location slap bang in the centre of it all. The breakfast is all-you-can-eat and is not bad. The hotel is clean and the staff are really nice. We requested another room after being stuck on the ground floor over the other side of the alley, it was a bit noisey and cold. However when we settled in another (smaller) room we realised that the noise is endemic throughout the hotel. You can hear your neighbours on both sides, above and below. Bathroom noises carry too. The place is full of life which is both it's high point and low point.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: ESTHERLREALTOR
Reviews.Content: LOCATION is wonderful hotel is small but super cozy and clean. Staff is friendly, helpful, and polite. Breakfast is the best. Crunchi bacon, eggs,cereals, orange juice and plenty of nutella. As soon as you step outside the rialty bridge is on your left and the canal is right in front of you. Piazza San Marcos is only a 10min walk. Could not ask for more, I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LouCheshire
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Venice to celebrate my birthday and we chose the Marconi as my partner had stayed there previously and said the location of the hotel couldn't be bettered. I have to admit that after reading some of the recent reviews about the concierge staff and the hotel I was a little apprehensive about going but upon arrival at the hotel the staff were very efficient, got us checked in immediately and were very polite and friendly. We booked a standard room which to be fair was very small, however, the bathroom was spotlessley clean, had a good shower and the bedroom itself had everything you would need for a short stay in Venice (minibar, small TV, hairdryer, wardrobe). If you want a plush hotel though with little luxuries this isn't the hotel for you. The location of the hotel was absolutely fantastic. A step outside the hotel front door and you're faced with the Rialto Bridge and just a short walk away from St Mark's Square which is ideal if you plan to see a lot of Venice on foot. The breakfast at the hotel was very nice and had a good selection of hot food and cereals, pastries and yoghurts. A tip for the gondolas - when we apporached a Gondola station we were told that it would cost us 150 euros for 40 minutes for just the two of us. However, we did manage to barter the guy down to 80 euros for 40 minutes and exclusive use of the gondola so don't accept the first price that they quote! Venice is a truly beautiful city and we had a wonderful stay, we would stay at the hotel Marconi again as the location was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: megatraveler10198
Reviews.Content: the male concierges were the RUDEST. I travel a lot and have had my share of experiences, but they were by far the worst. I want my money back. A friend of mine stayed here as well and when she came back she said the same thing. She said they made her feel uncomfortable because they had such an attitude about them. it was impossible to ask them a question about anything without them showing their claws. the rooms were decent and the breakfast was nice. but the concierges made it very difficult to have a good stay. i would try to book at any of the many hotels near the rialto bridge. Do not just book because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: brightmidnight8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the summer of 2004 on the recommendation of Time Out Venice. What a fabulous location. In summer 2008, I returned with some friends and stayed in a quad room. I was pleased with the quad room-- really a triple that had to be gerrymandered at the last minute into a quad-- and would recommend it. However, the quad faced an alley and when we opened the window, there was a syringe in the space between the window and the alleyway-- kind of ruined the atmosphere. I can't really expect them to police what is put on their windows from outside, but it would be nice if they did. We left so early this time that I didn't get a chance to try the breakfast, but on my first stay there it was delightful-- lots of Nutella! The front desk staff is very courteous and helpful with directions, and as I said, the location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: travelcat1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Marconi is right next to the Rialto Bridge. I wouldn't consider it a ritzy hotel but because of the location, I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Venice. St. Mark's square is a short walk away. If you are coming from the airport take the Vapereto (water taxi) to the Rialto stop. Once you get off the water taxi, you have to walk over the Rialto Bridge make a left and the hotel is a few entrances on the Right. The hotel is older. We upgraded to a Superior room which was a decent size. The standard room we saw (when we peeked in when the maid was cleaning) and it looks very small. The rooms are clean and that is the most important thing to me. There was a refridgerator and small TV. We were on the 4th Floor. To my knowledge there is not an elevator so everytime we had to go to our room we had to go up 4 flights of stairs. (After eating all the pizza and pasta we didn't mind), but for elderly or people having difficulty with stairs I would stay on a lower floor. There is a completmentary breakfast every morning downstairs. Bread, salami, cheese, juices and yogurts. I thought it was a nice touch. The restaurants outside the hotel are very pricy. I would recommend walking away from the touristy Rialto bridge area to eat dinner. Also, gondolas are a little pricy. If you plan on doing one make sure you bargain a price. Venice is such a beautiful city! We went in the end of September, the weather was perfect, and there was not large waits at the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Honeys
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Close to main attractions and about everything you want to see/have. Clean rooms and nice personnel. Good breakfast. Because of the location we can recommend this hotel to everybody who is going to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, okay room”
Reviews.Author: Squith
Reviews.Content: The location could not be any better, right by the Rialto bridge. We had only 1 day to spend in Venice, so it was perfect. We walked to the St. Mark's squre from the hotel, and really got to feel the Venice in such a short time. The room itself was okay- but did not worth the price. I guess the price is for the location. Well. The breakfast was fantastic. I was really happy to see eggs and bacons! and other warm hearty stuff! The room is so comforting and perfect for a quiet Venecian morning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - would go back!”
Reviews.Author: JME_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in July 08. As other reviewers have said the location is perfect right by the Rialto Bridge. The hotel is fairly old and our room could have done with a lick of paint and was slightly shabby. However the breakfast was great - lots of choice, the staff were helpful. Venice is gorgeous but I would avoid July/Aug as so busy. We also found the surrounding restaurants really expensive!! We generally paid 6 euros for a coke! Although hotel seemed expensive for what it was the location was fantastic and we had a great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: oxford37
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice. First time was absolutely fantastic - great location, rooms had character and staff were fantastically helpful. Second time all this was true but our room smelt of sewage. I would still recommend it though.

Reviews.Title: “mid-range hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ddsterling63
Reviews.Content: Marconi is an older, charming, middle-range hotel, in a great location. Itâ€™s situated at the midpoint of many destinations, and near a major waterbus stop (lines #1, 2, and others). We traveled as a family of four (kids 9 and 12) and stayed in one of the hotelâ€™s quad rooms. It was clean and comfortable â€“ not particularly spacious, but that is understandable in Venice. The breakfast had a wide variety of choices: eggs, breakfast meats, cereals, yogurts, cheese, breads, and much more. The staff was friendly and always available to give us advice on restaurants and other activities. There is no elevator so be ready to climb flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: keimimalave
Reviews.Content: Hotel Marconi was a wonderful experience for a budget traveler trying to find a beautiful and comfortable place to stay in one of the most beautiful cities in the world. We booked our hotel through Lastminute.com and was pleasantly supri sed to find how easy it was to get to...Literally, steps from the Ponte Rialto and our view from the Lobby was the Grand Canal which was absolutely breath taking...our room was wonderful elegant yet simple and was warm comfortable and clean...the bathroom was incredibly clean and the staff was so helpful as well as polite...they allowed us to check-in early after a long trip there and they actually carried our bags upstairs...they informed us of points of interest they speak several languages and were pretty much wonderful...Thank Goodness for Hotel Marconi!! Overall, I would definately return there and hopefully stay longer oh and by the way the complimentary breakfast was absolutely delicious and appealed all different types of pallettes. Go there, stay there and enjoy the picturesque city in one of the most wonderful hotels I've ever had the pleasure of staying in!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: nobody291
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marconi, mainly because of its location. The location is great....right on the Grande Canal a short distance from the Rialto Bridge. The area is very touristy. The restaurants around the hotel are pricey and not terribly friendly. We tried to have an afternoon snack at one of them right next to the canal. We wanted to share a pizza and have a couple of drinks...they said we had to each order food and kicked us out! They had plenty of open tables and I'm still puzzled at that treatment. Anyway, we spent our money elsewhere. The restaurants aren't the hotel's fault, but I thought the warning would be worthwhile. The front desk employees were friendly, attentive, and gave great restaurant suggestions (that were away from the main tourist areas). Also, the front desk employees were helpful is setting up a water taxi during the vaparetto strike that was taking place during our visit. The breakfast was acceptable. Meat, cheese, eggs, pastries, coffee, etc. Nothing terribly exciting, but plenty of food to keep you going through the day until dinner. Wireless internet service is available in the lobby. The room was a spacious triple. We had a queen bed and a single. There's also an option to have three singles (the queen is just 2 single beds made into one larger bed). The bathroom was nice as well. There were a couple of windows that opened onto a street below. We took a gondola ride and were promised a route that would take about 40 minutes for â‚¬70. The route ended up taking 20 minutes and, since you pay ahead of time, you have no recourse. I'd recommend either negotiating a certain amount of time rather than a route and paying when you're ride is over, if the gondoleer will allow it. The hotel doesn't have a lift, so you have to climb stairs to get to your room. A bellman was available to help with our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting and Service”
Reviews.Author: midwestern_traveler8
Reviews.Content: Returned to romantic Venice and the Marconi for second time. Location overlooking Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal incomparable from spacious (yes, actually spacious) balconied room. (there are two Canal view rooms- be sure to reserve the larger one). Location is close to market area, less than 10 minute walk to San Marco plazza, and overall convenient to catch canal transport including short boat ride from train station. Charles and staff are knowledgeable about dining, concerts and other things to do and see in Venice and readily make reservations for guest. Found them especially helpful as our arrival was complicated by one day Italian train strike, but they did everything reasonably possible to ensure our satisfaction and enjoyment of this return trip to Venice. Hopefully our travels take us back to Venice again soon- when they do, will be reserving that large canal view room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -So So Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pjmom45
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and our last stop on a 13 day tour of italy.(late June) We were a family of 6 (4 teens/preteens) and another couple. We booked 2 triple rooms and one double. we got 1 quad room and 2 doubles. We were informed that there was a mix up and that they would give us all balcony/ canal view rooms after the first night. My husband and 3 kids slept in the quad room. It was very crowded, dark and dingy, but the bathroom was pretty nice. They informed us that the double rooms were small, however we didn't realize how small until they opened the door to mine(which was at the other end of the hall from my husbands) and hit the bed with the door at the 1/2 way point. About the only thing that fit in the room was the bed. There may have been 24 inches between the bed and the walls. I could barely get my toiletrie bag thru the opening into the bathroom. (Which was actually very nice) When the suitcases were zipped they barely fit between the bed and wall. The other double room was better but still not very large. They moved us to rooms 101 and 102 the next day which were much bigger, but they still didn't make up for the rooms the night before or for having to pack and unpack again (after having done it 5 other times this trip). And they definitely were not worth the asking price. They did not move our quad room either. The breakfast was very good with a nice selection and the location was great, so I guess that's what we paid for. Two suggestions if you decide to stay here. Take a private water taxi to the hotel because it will drop you off out front, whereas the public ones drop you off across the canal and you will have to drag your luggage(for us 12 pieces) across the very crowded, hot, many steps Rialto bridge. And I would be very wary about taking suggestions from the staff (restaurants, gondolas,murano, shops)because after 1 or 2 times we thougtht that maybe they weren't as much in our best interests as in theirs. I would say that of all the hotels we stayed in Italy (5), based mainly on trip advisor, this was probably the worst. However, we were very pleased with all the others

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LizzyW
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location, very well priced and the staff could not have been more helpful. Having stayed in many hotels in Venice over the years, this was by far the best one for us. The breakfast was great, room sizes large we thought for Italy and the location was very central. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Marconi”
Reviews.Author: Kiely_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Great location. Breakfast is lovely. It is brillantly located to see the sights of Venice. We had a triple room & it was a good size. Didn't get a gondala as we were on abit of a budget but we did get the water bus ticket for 48 hours which was good value at â‚¬25. Water bus is a great way of getting around Venice. All in all a good experience & would recommend Hotel Marconi.

Reviews.Title: “fab location”
Reviews.Author: t60bon
Reviews.Content: me and my hubby have just returned from a four day trip to venice,where we stayed at the marconi hotel.on arrival i could not believe how accurate the reviews i had read on here were....it was exactly as described,right at the rialto bridge.you could not ask for a better location in my opinion.we checked in smoothly,the staff were so friendly,and a porter took us to our room.there is only one room with a canal view,and this was really expensive and not avvailable,so we stayed in room 106 it was really clean with air con,a mini bar,and a really clean bathroom which had lots of towels.the bed was agood size,and in the wardrobe there were spare pillows and blankets.the room was basic but hey who goes to venice and sits in there room.for a three star i thought it was how you would expect,and to be honest the location far outshone a luxourious room...breakfast was served till 10 and we really looked forward to this,it was delicious with a basket of fresh bread and croissants put on your table on arrival,there were cold meats,cheeses,scrambled eggs,bacon,and sausages in one area.fresh juices,coffee and a selection of flavoured teas,which i was pleased with as i only drink green tea and other hotels just dont provide it.you could have cereal to if you wished.we really filled up on the fresh fruit and yoghurts that were there too,it really was good value for money this hotel and i would go back tom.as you step out the hotel there were gondalas waiting we barted down to 80 euro from 120 so its worth a try.we really enjoyed our gondala ride,i know it might be cheesy but you have to do it.there are two restaurants either side of the hotel they r expensive but the one to the left as you come out of marconi was lovely we had many a nice drink while sat out lookin at the canal as well as a lovely meal.all in all this hotel was worth every penny if you go i guarentee you will enjoy it as much as we did..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: AlmaBeachBandB
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed at the Morconi Hotel and were thrilled with the expierence. The front desk men, Carlos and Stephanos were exceptional. They greeted us with warmth and consideration, helped us decide what to do during our brief stay and were so helpful regarding any questions we had. Our room was small, which is the reality in Europe, but immaculate and well appointed. The bathroom was also immaculate. The location is perfect! It is a convenient walk to anything you would care to see in Venice, plenty of restraunts both reasonable and expensive and wonderful shopping steps away. The breakfast was a huge surprise. The variety available will please any traveller, from hot croissant to ham and egg. It was available in the most delightful bright and clean breakfast room. The perfect way to start a day of exploring this magical city. I would only stay at the Marconi Hotel on my next visit to Venice. Thank you Carlos and Stephanos. Warmest Regards, Carol and Julianna

Reviews.Title: “Charming Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmd2450
Reviews.Content: Hotel Marconi is a jewel of a hotel set in a perfect location near the Rialto Bridge right on the canal. The front desk staff was amazingly efficient, gracious and always available to assist with recommendations for day trips and restaurants. The housekeeping staff was very accommodating in assisting with bed configurations in the room (we had 3 people in one room). The hotel provides a great breakfast with not only pastries, cereal and fruit, but they also have assorted meats and eggs. Charlie, at the front desk, was very charming and watched out for his American guests!

Reviews.Title: “When can we go again !”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiTravelingal
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Venice and we wanted our hotel to be in a central location for a good price and we found it at Hotel Marconi. The room was very nice and the staff very helpful. The breakfast was included and very ample...a great way to begin a day full of walking. The Hotel Marconi sits right on the Grand Canal across from a Vaporetto station and an easy walk with luggage but to my pleasant surprise the desk clerk arranged for a staff member to help me across the Rialto bridge with my luggage when I was going to catch the Vaporetto to head to the airport on my departure day. I will and I know my cousin will also...stay at this hotel again on our return to Venice. I have already told a few friends about our very wonderful experience. Keep it up Hotel Marconi...the value for the Euro was excellent ! Lisa Conway

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickJB
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location. It is 50 meters from the Rialto Bridge so very easy to find. The room although small, was clean and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful; with the concierge making reservations for us in some great restaurants that we would never have found without his help. Highly recommended. Tip -Instead of using the Rialto waterways stop you should get off at the San Sil Vestro stop (particularly when you first arrive with your cases)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: ClaireyBella
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading some reviews and getting pretty confused to be honest - some so enthusiastic and some so negative! What to believe?! Anyway, the hotel - we arrived at night which is never good in my opinion and unfortunately we went into the reception (all very nice) but were then lead out of the hotel and round into a dark alleyway and given room at the back of the hotel next to the alley. It was pretty small and you had to squeeze past the end of the bed to avoid getting caught in the curtains. Luckily we moved the next day but I think it also would have been noisy in the morning as the alley was right outside the window. After some gentle persuasion we moved rooms to one upstairs and a lot more central to the hotel. This room was a lot nicer, a bit bigger (still not huge but I think it was an okay size for Europe from what I can gather.) It was clean and nicely decorated. A little noisy outside in the mornings (building works I think) but I think thats to be expected from being in the ciy centre - that brings me onto the location. It was amazing! Really close to Rialto bridge so you could walk everywhere from there. It was lovely being able to walk out of the hotel in the morning and facing such a beautiful and picturesque view. Venice as a whole is pretty expensive and the hotel was in between two fairly expensive restaurants (5euros for a coffee?) but the hotel has a table and chairs outside looking onto the river so we often got a bottle of wine or hot choc for the shops and drank it out there. I did feel the hotel was fairly expensive for the interior etc. but I think the location makes up for it. I would recommend it - not for luxury but definately for a base for exploring, so therefore try and get a cheaper deal.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NikkiBird
Reviews.Content: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! You cannot beat it in our opinion but you MUST get room 101 with the balcony and two doors going out on to it. It is very pricey for a three star hotel but you will not regret it.
