Just to sit on the balcony and watch all the excitement of gondolas, water taxi's, water buses, people walking by and ofcourse the beauty of the Rialto Bridge only 100 feet away! The room was a decent size for Europe standards and the bathroom was very modern and clean. They even have piped in music! Breakfast was very adequate and they had no problem filling up a tray for us with everything we wanted so we could have our coffee and breakfast on the balcony. Room 102 next door has a small balcony and one door but the room is very small. Go for room 101 and spend the bit extra as you get alot more for it. If we ever return to Venice, we WILL be staying at Hotel Marconi in room 101! The Holmes' Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: PKN10
Reviews.Content: Prime location!! The Marconi hotel is conveniently located on the Grand Canal next to the Rialto bridge. The hotel serves a great breakfast and the front desk staff was very helpful in suggesting activities since we had never been to Venice before. The rooms are small but clean. There's no hotel elevator, but we didn't mind since we were on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slammeruk
Reviews.Content: I paid for a superior double and booked it directly via their own web-site as on lastminute and expedia they both stated that there was nothing available. Carlos responded to my emails very quickly and he gave me a 10% discount off the published web-site prices. On arrival I was greated by Carlos and was initially disappointed with my room that it overlooked an alley way (Room 203), but Carlos explained that only 2 out of 26 rooms overlooked the canal and they were another 200 Euros a night !!! Thats where the disappointed ended, the room was very clean and tidy - a reasonable size and good air con, the breakfast had an excellent choice (Cereals, toast, yoghurt, hot choice, cake, etc), the staff were very friendly and they even let us take our own bottle of Proseco and drink it outside the hotel each evening to watch the world go by - You must all do this as it was a superb way to sit down and relax (They even supplied glasses for us) - This by far made up for the lack of view from our room as we only used it to sleep and get changed. One last thing - the location was superb, it was our first time in Venice and if you got lost you just followed the signs to the Rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Carlo, Simone, and Frederico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the Hotel Marconi in Veneto and enjoyed every minute! Thanks to the efficiency of the Hotel Clerks - Carlo, Simone, and Frederico - we truly had a memorable stay. They were more than willing to help any way that they could. The hotel was clean, and the breakfasts were excellent - the two ladies who served the breakfast were very good and very efficient. Thanks for a great stay in Veneto!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the middle of the day and a porter helped with our bags. With no elevator this could be a problem as others have experienced if there is no porter. The rooms are small but well appointed. We were there during cool weather so we liked opening the windows. This was a problem because of the noise. However, when you want a central location on the Grand Canal this is what you have to put up with. I thought the hotel description was accurate and we had no surprises. We got an excellent recommendation for a tour guide from the front desk and our experience at the Doge's Palace while E50 per hour was worth it. The offer for a water taxi ride to tour a Mirano glass factory was worth the ride. The glass however is very very high end art glass, but there is lots of commercial glass to choose from. A multi-day vaporatto pass is essential and the best way to get around for the most reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: bill4347
Reviews.Content: The hotel was superior as to location and services provided. The staff; especially Carlos the day manager was willing and able to help in all respects. Other amenities were well appreciated and the staff made our stay a refreshing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overbooked; general Venetian problem.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marconi for 2 nights way back in February. On arrival we were told by Carlos that a computer virus on their system disrupted their booking system, therefore we would have to move to a different hotel in the centre of town. I told Carlos of having read various reports right here of overbookings with the excuse of air conditioning problems (this excuse couldn't be used in this case due to the ambient temperature). On mentioning our various feelings of 'unhappiness' at being moved to a "new hotel" away from the Grand Canal (the last thing we wanted was some American concrete block) and mentioning our rights in regards insurance and credit cards Carlos became quite aggressive and stated that Italian law permitted relocation as long as it was an 'upgrade'. We insisted on viewing the 'Superior Double' we had booked against his utmost declaration that it was not ready yet (it was) so that we knew what we were comparing the replacement with. Off we trapsed, ensuring he knew we were only "checking it out". Incredible how grey and miserable the Rialto and surrounds had suddenly seemed to turn after our glorious arrival only 45 mins previously! To cut a long story short, the hote we went to, the Duodo Palace, was marvellous, full of character and a small canal outside our window. It is entirely possible that the ammunition of foreknowledge this site had given us, together with not signing anything before checking the rooms helped get us the best result. But this is not purely a Marconi problem. 3 other visiting parties we talked to had had the same experience but with worse outcome and they were all booked into different hotels. Another point is that every single arrangement we had made through Expedia, except the actual flight, presented problems: the water taxi from airport to the Rialto (my booking sheet suddenly had vanished), the 'Secret Tour' of the Doge's Palace (the booking form was incorrect) and the afore mentioned hotel booking. But fortunately it did all work out well in the end. Careful handling, in one case sefety in numbers, maybe luck, and of course the beauty of Venice made our 3 day stay magical in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: ross76
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 2 week stay in Italy, where we spent our last 4 nights at the Hotel Marconi in Venice. Before you stay at this hotel you should read this! 1. When we arrived we were told there was a problem with our Standard Double room and we would have to stay in a "small" room for 1 night. No explanation about the problem was given, but looking at the other reviews I guess that this is just another case of over booking. Small room was an understatement, this was a single room made up as a double (headboard on bed was only single) and the room was so small that you could only get in and out of the bed from the bottom end!!! Compensation came in the form of a bottle of fizzy wine!! 2. Double room then materialised on the second day, it was clean but over looked an alleyway where workman are currently replacing drainage. The works start at 7.45am and continue to 5pm. Reading the worker's sign it looks like this is a big project and will continue for some time. The noise during the day was unbearable with circular saws and hammers being used - you could not stay in your room during the day! 3. During the night the lack of sound proofing and ill-fitting windows became more evident as all alley noise could be heard - there is also a cafe close by which doesn't shut until late! In addition, unless your room neighbours are not speaking to each other, you will hear every word they say and know when they are moving about. Yes the Hotel Marconi has a great location but we will never stay there again. Remember Venice is a very walk able place with great water transport, and if we do go back we will look for a hotel a bit further away from Rialto Bridge and walk.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: jk64799
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Hotel Marconi last week and had a great experience. Perfect location, and found the Staff outstanding. A little noisy, but it was a tradeoff to be in such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Marconi was absolutely a wonderful place to stay. The staff was more than courteous. They were helpful in many ways, including suggesting activities, churches (for services), resturants, and tours - without being pushy. The hotel is located several doors down from the famous Rialto Bridge. Front rooms have a fantastic view of the bridge and the Grand Canal. The rooms were more than comfortable, and roomier than expected. The bathrooms were up to date and roomy as well. Love the heated towel bars!!!! The breakfast offered more items than we had anticipated - including eggs and bacon. The Hotel Marconi spoiled us for the rest of our tour of Italy. I would not hesitate to recommend this establishment and I would certainly go back. The only thing I would recommend is that if you are traveling with heavy luggage, take one of the 'for-hire' water taxis to the Hotel Marconi. The public water taxi stop is on the other side of the Grand Canal and pulling or carrying leavy luggage up and down the steps on the Rialto Bridge is at best difficult. Thank you to the staff of the Hotel Marconi for making my first trip overseas memorable and welcoming. I hope to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in Venice. We had booked the Marconi but when we got to the hotel we were told that we would have to stay in another hotel for two nights while the air conditioning was fixed, after which we could return to the Marconi. On the morning we were due to return to the Marconi we were told that we could not return to the Marconi and would have to move to a different hotel. After we complained we were told that we could actually stay at the Marconi!. We doubted the truth of the air conditioning tale and think that the hotel over books on the strength of its location and then moves customers to less full hotels in the chain. We were also extremely disappointed with the surly reception staff, they seem to have no concept of customer care and were quite aggresive with us. Extremely disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its' good reputation”
Reviews.Author: CodgerChris
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly lived up to its' positive reputation of the majority of these reviews. Reception was efficient and friendly and my Expedia booking promptly confirmed and processed on arrival. We had booked one of the "deluxe" en-suite double rooms which was fine, tidy and very clean. Without doubt the deluxe means "slighty-larger". Yes it's right you can hear your next-door neighbour, especially the flushing of loo etc., but it's really no problem. Shutters on all windows with mostly alley-way views, but then the real views start just 10m from the hotel entrance! Spacious breakfast room is also very good as described by many others, superfast clearing of tables and an excellent selection. Not having a bar was not a problem for us, but please note tea/coffee only available at breakfast. Superb central Rialto location. For me, Expedia booking most economical way of booking. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Locatio Location Location”
Reviews.Author: goingtosail
Reviews.Content: We chose the Marconi because of a great winter rate through this site. The location is magical. The hotel is nice but I could see that if we were there in a busier season it would be very noisy. I also was put off by the hard sell for tours at the front desk. Our room was small but functional, very clean and comfortable, the breakfast was very good. I would recommend the Hotel Marconi because of the location, it is an authentic Venetian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Marconi”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first year anniversary in Venice and decided to stay at Hotel Marconi based on its location right on the Grand Canal and the good reviews it received. We were not disappointed! Our room was charming with that authentic Venetian feel (there was even a metal mirror to top it off.) The cleaning staff did an excellent job in keeping our room immaculate everyday, and the staff really knows how to take care of its customers. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were told that there was an available room at a "sister" hotel just on the other side of the Grand Canal with a Canal view room. The room was offered to us for one night at no extra charge. We even had help carrying our luggage all the way across the Rialto bridge to get to the other hotel. What a great way to spend the first night in Venice! The staff was also helpful in providing suggestions on places to eat. We tried every restaurant recommended to us and we were pleased with them all. If you're looking for a good quality, centrally located hotel with true Venetian feel, Hotel Marconi is the right place to book.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Banyan-Babe
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay at the Marconi for Â£202 on Lastminute which seemed to be good value. Overall we were not disappointed. Like a couple of the other reviewers, we had emailed the hotel to request a room with a view but the email was returned as not deliverable (we used the email address on the hotel website). We also phoned but the man asked us to call back the next day as he was busy (we didn't call back). Arriving at the Marconi is a delight - if you arrive by train, simply take the Vaperetto number 82 up the Grand Canal. It only takes a few minutes and costs 5 Euros each. Disembark at the Rialto stop and you only need to walk over the bridge to get to the Marconi. We received a warm welcome at the Marconi - the lobby area is very clean and there is a great smell of freshness. The receptionist told us he could recommend some restaurants and also told us to take the free boat to Murano the next day. We declined but he didn't seem too concerned. He also gave us a pass to the casino which we didn't use. Like a previous reviewer, we also asked if we could have a canal view room and were told it would incur a 140 Euro supplement per night!! This was more than we had paid for the room so there was no way we were going to take him up on his offer. Our room was small but spotless (apart from a very dusty headboard!) and the bed left much to be desired as it was quite uncomfortable. I quite liked the fact that the room was small - it was cosy and we settled in straightaway. Breakfast was good and food plentiful. The best thing about the Marconi is its location. It is right next to the Rialto Bridge which means that every time you step out of the door, you are greeted with gondalas and the incredible bridge. It is also extremely central for St Mark's Square and every district of Venice is within walking distance. We grew to dislike the bar / restaurant next door to the Marconi. On our first night, we had a couple of small beers there and were charged 14 Euros. Every time we stepped out of the hotel, the bar men would hassle us to drink there again and we grew to really dislike their arrogance. There are far better, more atmospheric and cheaper places to drink in the quaint back streets. If you're on a budget, Venice has a few supermarkets which are a bit hard to find. For directions, just ask one of the many people you'll see carrying a yellow "Billa" carrier bag. At Billa, you can get some great, reasonably priced food and drink. Decent wine is about Â£3 a bottle and a can of Coca Cola is under half a Euro. Significantly less than the 2 and a half Euros charged in smaller shops. Overall we loved Venice, particularly exploring the smaller, quieter back streets. We like to eat well but found some of the restaurants to be mediocre and expensive for the quality of food. We also found that in January, the city started to fall asleep at about 10pm which was a shame. It is also worthy of note that all bars and restaurants are non-smoking so having a drink and cigarette late at night in a bar is not an option. Go to Venice - it really is unique but don't be ripped off. We found the best restaurants were those hidden away and full of Italians. The best things about Venice - wandering around the streets and taking in the views from the numerous bridges - were free.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a mother who traveled with my two boys (ages 7, 10) over New Year's to Venice. Our stay at the Marconi was average, and I would definitely not return again. The positives: Great location to Rialto bridge and all water buses, etc. The negatives: thin doors, thin walls, hear all other guests coming and going throughout the night. I also did NOT take a liking to the front desk, who immediately was selling me concerts, "special New Years" boat trips to the glass factories, etc. This was was not my first trip to Venice, and I was sorry that he felt that I could be so easily "sold" on these tourist tricks. He also quoted a rather high price to move to a canal-view room. My husband is in the hotel business and works for a very exclusive chain. When I told him about the cost to "upgrade" he got a good laugh out of it. Other complaints, depressing room, late wake-up calls, and cold shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Marconi”
Reviews.Author: RGTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Marconi, booked thru Expedia. This hotel is located just steps from the Rialto Bridge and is within easy walking distance to all the major sights. We had 2 rooms; #404 was quite spacious with three windows overlooking alleys and rooftops; #402 was a smaller, more standard room. Both were very clean and in fine condition. Breakfast was substantial with an assortment of breads, cereals, meats, cheeses plus eggs and bacon. The staff (Carlo, Federico & Thomosino?) were all pleasant, cordial and helpful. They arranged a water taxi for our arrival and 5:30 AM departure! As with many older, authentic buildings, the Marconi does not have an elevator and this could pose a problem for some; but it didn't bother us. We were on the 4th floor and all the floors seem identical; so room #204 or #304 might be also worth booking if they are the same floor plan as #404. The off-season rate was very attractive, but I don't know how expensive rooms would be in peak season. A great restaurant, Alla Madonna, is just 100 yds around the corner. All in all, this is a delightful hotel in a fabulous location and we would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having culled what I could from the web in advanced I settled on aiming for Room 101 at the Hotel Marconi. It was expensive, but it was important to get that particular room, I was taking my girl to Venice for her birthday and the whole experience had to be good. Room 101 has a narrow balcony overlooking the Grand Canal and a view of the Rialto bridge. The room was fantastic, very late 19th century feeling with none of the inconvenience. Of course, having great weather in November really helped the mood too. The only problem was that they had trouble getting a couple of my shirts ironed, which I found a bit unusual in a hotel of that calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the Hotel Marconi”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Marconi during a recent trip to Venice. I am not one to ever review a hotel but in this case I had to. I had a wonderful stay at the Marconi. The location was perfect, the reception area is beautiful and my room was spacious and very clean. I am especially grateful to Carlo Lachin who treated me so well, being a single woman traveling alone I felt very comfortable. This is why I would only stay at the Hotel Marconi during my during my next trip to Venice . Thanks Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one day and one night in Venice at the Hotel Marconi, after spending 5 days in Florence. The Hotel Marconi experience was perfect. I had investigated on-line many different possibilities since we only had one night in Venice, before renting a car the next morning to drive to Cinque Terre. This hotel seemed right because of the location right on the Grand Canal by the Rialto Bridge. The water Taxi we took from the train station was able to dock right in front of the hotel so we didn't have to drag our luggage very far. The people running the place were very friendly and helpful. We had requested a room with a view and were not disappointed when we found out we had 2 balconies overlooking the Rialto and the Grand Canal. By Italian standards the room was good sized and the bathroom even had a tub. Just when we thought it couldn't get any better, the staff delivered a complimentary bottle of champage. We took a gondola ride with champage and glasses in hand, and then went out to a very nice restaurant the desk manager had recommended. Breakfast was also more than we expected the next morning and was included in our room price. The price of the room may have been a little high, but it was well worth it. Our short stay in Venice was wonderful and we will most likely stay at the Hotel Marconi again, hopefully for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jay Kyle
Reviews.Content: My review is a little late but I wanted to weigh in on the Hotel Marconi. It couldn't be better located. At the foot of the Rialto Bridge. We had a room on the 3rd floor with a view of the alley. So what!! The room was clean and spacious and quiet. I didn't come to Venice to look out a hotel window. Step outside and view Venice from the Rialto Bridge. Spectacular. Centrally located, just minutes from St Marks Square and right next to the market area. This area is where Venice is most alive. The breakfast buffet was very nice and quite substantial for European Hotels. The staff was somewhat aloof but had boots for us when high tide flooded the entire city. It was fun, adventurous, and romantic to slosh around in the magical world of Venice. I would definately stay at the Marconi again. It is exactly what I expect when I travel to Europe, a clean affordable place to rest and sleep that is centrally located. I didn't go there to hibernate in a hotel room. I spent every minute exploring the streets of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Only the point is location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only situation is good, the rest is poor. There is no lift (we had to bring up to 4th floor), poor breakfast. The worst point is staff. Most of receptionists were not gentleman. (I wonder they are temporaly worker or students.) I'll never stay again. After staying at this hotel, I became very nerves to choose hotel in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (three guests) loved the Hotel Marconi in Venice, just a few steps from the Rialto Bridge with views to the Canale Grande and 10 minutes to San Marco- in the very heart of the Serenissima. Nice rooms, very clean bathrooms, nicely styled and comfortable lobby. Every day an excellent breakfast is offered. TV and air conditioning worked fine. 24 hours concierge: whoever was in charge gave us very good advice as to short trips, concerts, negotiating prices with gondolas. Also very fine restaurants nearby (as the Antico Calice). We are planning to come again - it was a pleasure to visit Venice with such a hotel to stay. The description/photos from the website really do match reality! --------- Berna, Guido & Sylvia

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and Carlos!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice little hotel with a fabulous concierge, Carlo, on duty during our stay. He recommended an amazing, off the beaten path, local restaurant to us that was the highlight of our trip--truly a memorable evening. I've been to Venice twice and that was the only great meal (food, service, hospitality, etc.) I've had there. Carlo knew we would enjoy the free boat ride to Murano but said we shouldn't feel pressured to buy anything (Murano is known for glassblowing). I'm glad he said that or else I would have been disappointed that he didn't warn us. We did end up buying a few items at another shop away from the factory where we were looked down upon for not purchasing the "very overpriced" items. There was a sweet guy demonstrating his art of blowing glass, however, and that made it worthwhile. Anyway, I wanted to get out of Murano as soon as possible. Don't go there if you can help it. There's too much to see on Venice. Back at the hotel, there was a variety of foods on offer for breakfast, which was nice. I got a scolding from one of the kitchen ladies when I put my croissant in the toaster, but other than that everyone at Hotel Marconi was really helpful and charming. The rooms were well-appointed and comfortable. Air conditioning, comfortable beds, nice bathrooms all added to the experience, even if the rooms were on the 4th floor. We didn't have a view, but I knew that would be the case when we booked. We still had natural light from the windows, however. The hotel is right on the Grand Canal so there's no need to feel pressured to have a view from your room, even though some of the rooms do have one. You just need to go to the lobby of the hotel and your view is right there. Other benefits: The hotel will exchange your dollars for euros at a decent rate, which was a service that was helpful to us. There were no surprises at check-out, which is always a good sign. The hotel looks after your bags on the day you check out. They'll even carry them down for you upon check-out. Great Place. The service we received from Carlo moved it from above average to excellent. I would definitely stay there again, but I won't be putting my croissant in the toaster next time. ;-)
